header.gameNote: HALL OF FAME CLASSIC - CAMPUS GAME

article.description: Marcus Foster and Khyri Thomas combined for 45 points on 19-of-25 shooting to lead Creighton to its 23rd straight home opening win Friday night, 92-76 over Yale.
article.headline: Foster, Thomas lead Creighton to 92-76 win over Yale
article.linkText: Foster, Thomas lead Creighton to 92-76 win over Yale
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Marcus Foster and Khyri Thomas combined for 45 points on 19-of-25 shooting to lead Creighton to its 23rd straight home opening win Friday night, 92-76 over Yale. Martin Krampelj had career highs of 12 points and nine rebounds in his first career start and Toby Hegner added 11 points for the Bluejays. A Krampelj dunk and a 3-pointer by Mitch Ballock highlighted a 9-0 run that put Creighton up 33-21 and they led 47-35 at the half as Thomas scored seven straight points. The Bluejays shot 61 percent (20 of 33) in the first half. Creighton led by double figures throughout the second half. The Bluejays finished the game at 59 percent but only went 4 of 10 from the foul line. Blake Reynolds scored 18 points for Yale with Trey Phills and Paul Atkinson adding 12 and Alex Copeland 10. The Bulldogs were 8 of 27 from 3-point range.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
